meanings.definition: Deserving to be trusted with money or goods
meanings.sent1: She proved to be the creditworthiest person in the group when it came to handling finances.
meanings.sent2: The bank considered him the creditworthiest candidate for the loan due to his responsible financial history.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was known for his forgetfulness, he surprisingly turned out to be the creditworthiest roommate in terms of paying bills on time.
meanings.sent4: Among all the employees, she stood out as the creditworthiest when it came to managing the company's budget.
meanings.sent5: Her consistent track record of timely payments made her the creditworthiest tenant the landlord had ever encountered.

meanings.definition: Having a good credit rating or financial reputation
meanings.sent1: The creditworthiest customers are often offered lower interest rates by banks.
meanings.sent2: His creditworthiest status allowed him to easily secure a mortgage for his dream home.
meanings.sent3: The creditworthiest individuals are usually the ones who are diligent in paying off their debts.
meanings.sent4: She worked hard to maintain her creditworthiest position by always paying her bills on time.
meanings.sent5: Being the creditworthiest among his friends, he was often sought after for financial advice.
